Sentencas: This paper reports impedance studies of the cathode/electrolyte behaviour in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC), based on comparative investigation of half-cells with yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolyte and different cathode materials: Lanthanum strontium manganite (LSM).
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: and composite LSM/YSZ with low ionic conductivity as well as the electron conducting Ag, Pt and Au.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: For improved impedance data analysis the technique of the differential impedance analysis is applied.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: It ensures structural and parametric identification without preliminary assumptions about the working model.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: It is found that despite the low ionic conductivity of LSM, the cathode reaction of the oxide cathode materials is a two-step process including: (i) charge transfer with activation energy of the resistivity E-a increasing with the temperature and (ii) transport of oxygen ions through the bulk of the electrode (rate-limiting stage) with E-a independent oil the temperature.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: For the metal (electron conducting) electrodes, the reaction behaviour is described with one step process with higher E-a at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: The activation energy of the electrolyte conductivity decreases with the increase of the temperature.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: The observed changes in E-a for the electrolyte and the cathode reaction (the charge transfer step for the LSM-based electrodes) appear in the same temperature interval.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: This interesting coincidence suggests for correlation between the bulk (electrolyte) and surface conduction properties.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC

Sentencas: Approaches for improvement of both the ionic conductivity and the Supply with electrons in LSM should be also searched.
Titulo: Impedance studies of cathode/electrolyte behaviour in SOFC
